intro: Calymenia angustifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved calymenia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and showy, pinkish-white flowers that bloom in clusters. Native to tropical and subtropical regions, this plant thrives in moist, well-drained soils. The plant has a compact growth habit and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Its botanical features make it a distinctive addition to gardens and botanical collections.
